sentence.Network_en: Marcia smiled wanly and shook her head.
sentence.Network_cn: 马西娅苍白无力地一笑，摇了摇头。

entry.tran: 苍白的;有倦容的;疲惫的
entry.def: If you describe someone as wan, you mean that they look pale and tired.

example.ex: All she could manage was a thin, wan smile.
example.tran: 她只能挤出一丝疲惫的笑容。

means.word_mean: 1. in a weak or pale or languid manner;

auth_sentence.content: Smiling wanly, the man waved us through.
auth_sentence.res_content: Smiling wanly, the man waved us through.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Smiling wanly, the man waved us through.

auth_sentence.content: "His English is pretty good," one official joked wanly.
auth_sentence.res_content: "His English is pretty good," one official joked wanly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "His English is pretty good," one official joked wanly.

auth_sentence.content: There's an awful lot of wan naturalism that TV supplants no less wanly.
